headerTitle: Empowering You to Protect Your Personal Data & Privacy
headerSubtitle: The DPA is here to ensure your rights are respected. Below are common privacy risks and how you can protect yourself.
spamLinksRisk: Malicious links on platforms like Facebook may lead to phishing attacks, malware installation, or data breaches.
spamLinksTips: Avoid clicking on suspicious links or unknown ads
Enable advanced spam filters in your browser or email
Keep your devices and antivirus software up to date
Report harmful links to the platform
identityTheftRisk: Scammers may impersonate you on social media to gain access to your finances or social contacts.
identityTheftTips: Use strong, unique passwords for each account
Do not share personal credentials with anyone
spamTextRisk: Messages on Facebook, WhatsApp, or Messenger may contain malicious links.
spamTextTips: Ignore and block messages from unknown senders
Report spam to the relevant platform
keepingPersonalInfoRisk: Your bank account, national ID, passport, and other documents are highly sensitive.
keepingPersonalInfoTips: Never share such information publicly or online
Store physical documents in a secure place
Use encrypted platforms and strong passwords
Avoid sending personal data over unsecured channels
nuisanceCallsRisk: Unwanted or scam phone calls can compromise your privacy.
nuisanceCallsTips: Keep your number private and avoid unnecessary sharing
Report persistent or fraudulent calls to your service provider and DPA
Never disclose sensitive data over a phone call
phishingMessagesRisk: Cybercriminals send fake emails or messages pretending to be from trusted sources.
phishingMessagesTips: Don’t click links or open attachments from unknown senders
Confirm the legitimacy of any message before sharing information
Use a spam filter and update your email security settings
otpRisk: Your OTP is a secure access key.
otpTips: Never share OTPs with anyone — not even friends or family
Only enter OTPs on trusted, verified platforms
Be cautious of calls or messages requesting your OTP
handlingBankLines: Privacy in Public Spaces (e.g., Banks or Schools)
handlingBankLinesRisk: Be mindful of your surroundings when accessing or discussing private information.
handlingBankLinesTips: Avoid discussing personal or financial matters aloud
Use online services where possible to reduce exposure
Shield documents and devices from view in public
schoolIDandCertsRisk: Your school ID and certifications are part of your identity.
schoolIDandCertsTips: Do not share them online or with unknown parties
Keep digital backups in a password-protected system
publicInfoSecurityRisk: Medical records are highly sensitive and legally protected.
publicInfoSecurityTips: Only share with licensed medical professionals or verified institutions
Avoid posting or transmitting medical data online
Use secure digital platforms and strong passwords
Keep physical documents in a locked location
protectingHealthRecordsRisk: Medical records are highly sensitive and legally protected.
protectingHealthRecordsTips: Only share with licensed medical professionals or verified institutions
Avoid posting or transmitting medical data online
Use secure digital platforms and strong passwords
Keep physical documents in a locked location
ctaDesc: If your personal data is misused, you receive suspicious communications, or you become a victim of data abuse, report it to the DPA immediately.
